result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Todd Hewitt

defendant.name: Hewitt, Michael Todd

records.addlTxt: and Motion for Pretrial Orders - Atty Sager

and Arraignment. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court advises Defendant of rights. Court finds probable cause and binds case over. Reading of Information waived - NG pleas entered - PTC date scheduled.
Pre-trial conference on December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).  No use or possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant to get fingerprinted and photographed.
Deft appears while in custody via video.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled - time limits waived.  Defendant to provide fingerprints/photographs.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
